medical_history.chief_complaint: Colicky epigastric and right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain associated with nausea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 4 days ago, resolving for a day, then resuming as constant, severe, sharp RUQ and epigastric pain on the morning of admission. The patient attempted to vomit but was unable. Reports of flatus; last bowel movement was the morning of admission. Denies fevers, chills, or diarrhea.
past_medical_history: Right breast grade II ductal carcinoma in situ; status post biopsy and surgical excision
Cervical radiculopathy secondary to a herniated disk with foraminal narrowing at C4-C5 and C5-C6
medical_history.family_history: Family history remarkable for two sisters with breast cancer, one sister with ___ disease diagnosed at the age of ___, another sister with a pacemaker placed at the age of ___. Mother with diabetes and hypertension. No history of myocardial infarctions or cerebrovascular accidents in the family.
